title: got banned for defending my brother from getting bullied
body: good job riot you did it again...

replies.body:
I went ahead and pulled up the logs that ended up being punished to get a good idea of what went down. Certain phrases cross the line between friendly banter and toxic behavior, and it doesn't seem like the chat logs paint the same picture as the title here. 

I don't want to give out your personal chat logs here in public, but you're always more than welcome to shoot our player behavior team a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for more context on why those logs were actioned on.

Without chat logs, I can only make assumptions, given those assumptions, I would guess that you were not actually defending him. Defending your brother would be helping him mute the other player, then you and/or him reporting the other player. You retaliated. You bullied the bully, making you a bully in the process.

You can try to appeal with a support ticket. There is no guarantee of success with that, but it is your best bet. If this was your first offense, sometimes they take that into consideration. In addition, if this was your first offense, the maximum punishment would be a 14-day suspension.
